# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/containers.py
@source-hash: 73fe7a4f171e7466
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:06Z

## Purpose
Container classes for Rich console rendering library. Provides two list-like containers that can be rendered to console: `Renderables` for generic renderable objects and `Lines` for text lines with advanced formatting capabilities.

## Key Classes

### Renderables (L30-64)
List-like container for any objects that can be rendered to console.
- `__init__` (L33-38): Accepts optional iterable of RenderableType objects
- `__rich_console__` (L40-44): Core Rich protocol method - yields renderables directly
- `__rich_measure__` (L46-57): Calculates min/max width requirements across all contained renderables
- `append` (L59-60): Adds new renderable to container
- `__iter__` (L62-63): Provides iteration over internal renderables list

### Lines (L66-167)  
Specialized container for Text objects with advanced text justification and formatting.
- `__init__` (L69-70): Accepts iterable of Text objects
- Standard list interface: `__getitem__` (L78-87), `__setitem__` (L89-91), `__len__` (L93-94)
- `__rich_console__` (L96-100): Renders each line with line breaks
- `append/extend/pop` (L102-109): Standard list manipulation methods
- `justify` (L111-167): **Complex text alignment method** supporting left, center, right, and full justification with overflow handling

## Key Dependencies
- `.cells.cell_len`: For measuring text width in console cells
- `.measure.Measurement`: For calculating rendering dimensions  
- `.text.Text`: Text objects with styling (imported conditionally in justify method)
- Rich console types via TYPE_CHECKING imports

## Critical Patterns
- **Rich Protocol Compliance**: Both classes implement `__rich_console__` for rendering integration
- **Measurement Protocol**: Renderables implements `__rich_measure__` for layout calculations
- **Fluent Interface**: Lines.__setitem__ returns self for method chaining
- **Full Justify Algorithm** (L143-167): Complex space distribution algorithm that evenly distributes extra spaces across words, working right-to-left to handle remainders

## Architectural Notes
- Container abstraction allows treating collections of renderables as single renderable units
- Lines provides sophisticated text layout capabilities beyond simple line storage
- Both classes bridge between Python collections and Rich's rendering system
- Full justification skips last line to avoid awkward spacing in paragraphs
